contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=May 2010}} '''Ed McTaggart''' (born July 10, 1951) is an American [[drummer]] and [[artist]]. He is best known as the drummer of the rock band [[Daniel Amos]].<ref>{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p51672/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography: Daniel Amos (DA)|last=Allender|first=Mark W. B.|publisher=[[All Media Guide|AMG]]|accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref> McTaggart joined DA in 1976, after years of playing with [[Bill Sprouse Jr.]]'s band The Road Home.<ref name="EofCCM">{{cite book |last=Powell |first= Mark Allan |title=Encyclopedia of Contemporary Christian Music |publisher=Hendrickson Publishers |year=2002 |location=Peabody, Massachusetts |page=769 |isbn=1-56563-679-1}}</ref> In the 1980s, McTaggart became the V.P. of Creative Services for [[Frontline Records (1980s)|Frontline Records]].<ref name="EofCCM">{{cite book |last=Powell |first= Mark Allan |title=Encyclopedia of Contemporary Christian Music |publisher=Hendrickson Publishers |year=2002 |location=Peabody, Massachusetts |page=232 |isbn=1-56563-679-1}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Daniel Amos}} {{Persondata | NAME = McTaggart, Ed | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = July 10, 1951 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:McTaggart, Ed}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American rock drummers]] [[Category:American musicians]] [[Category:American photographers]] [[Category:American artists]] {{US-rock-drummer-stub}} {{US-photographer-stub}}
